AdditionalAttributes.Description: Identifies the type of data by combining platform, beam mode type, and coverage (frame/swath)

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASCENDING_DESCENDING
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes whether the satellite travel direction was ascending towards the north pole, or descending towards the south pole.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_SIZE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The number of SAR images over the same location in the entire ASF archive. Used for data that may be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: In most cases the same as beam mode. For Radarsat indicates both resolution and off-nadir pointing angle. Standard beam mode becomes ST1 though ST7 beammodetype, with ST7 pointing farthest from the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_BASELINE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The perpendicular distance between two satellites when they took the related two images. Useful for identifying image pairs to use for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_FRAME_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: ID of the center frame

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_ESA_FRAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The European Space Agency equivalent to the value in the FRAME_NUMBER field

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ACQUISITION_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Date the data was acquired by the satellite or aircraft + instrument.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: MISSION_NAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The sitenames where AIRSAR, AIMOSS, and UAVSAR acqusitions were taken.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the center of the scene or frame.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The general type of active sensor used. Values indicate image resolution: such as standard, fine, wide, scansar wide, SM (strip mode), EW (extra wide). Or indicate resolution + polarization: FBS (fine beam dual polarization), FBD (fine beam dual pol). Or atypically the type of product: TOPSAR (high resolution DEM), RPI (repeat pass interferometry), XTI (across track interferometry). Or resolution and product type IW (interferometric wide).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_DESC
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Text that describes the beam mode

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates the type of product, such as browse, metadata, L1, complex, amplitude, projected, terrain corrected.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DESCRIPTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes what the data was processed to. For example: low resolution terrain corrected ALOS data.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FRAME_NUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The designated frame or scene as defined by various space agencies (ESA, JAXA, CSA) each of which have their own scheme. The frame describes a box over the Earth at a fixed latitude. Combined with a path number (for longitude it identifies a specific piece of ground).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_LEVEL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates how much processing has been done to the data: L1, L1.0 unprocessed; L1.1 single look complex; L1, L1.5 amplitude image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The date the data was processed

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging began nearest the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: DOPPLER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The doppler centroid frequency - Useful for sar processing and interferometry. Related to the squint of the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE_DISPLAY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Label that will be displayed in ASF's Vertex interface

AdditionalAttributes.Name: POLARIZATION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Radar transmissions are polarized, with components normally termed vertical (V) and horizontal (H). Vertical means that the electric vector is in the plane of incidence; horizontal means the electric vector is perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: THUMBNAIL_URL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: URL that points to this granule's thumbnail image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASF_PLATFORM
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Internal ASF platform name

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: An ASF-assigned unique number used internally to unifiy SAR images over the same location. Used for data that might be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: LOOK_DIRECTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: SAR imagery is taken with the sensor pointing either left or right of the satellite. Most data is right-looking. A small amount of Radarsat is left-looking.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PATH_NUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The path describes a path the satellite will follow over the earth similar to longitude; each path has an assigned number. Combined with a frame number is identifies a specific piece of ground.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FARADAY_ROTATION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: An effect of the ionisphere that rotates polarizations from HH or VV or HV or VH. Significant for L or P band. Rotation over 5 degrees reduces usefulness for applications such as forest biomass. Effect is reduced at solar minimum.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BYTES
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Product size in bytes.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the center of the scene or frame.

meta.native-id: UAVSAR_POLSAR_ML_COMPLEX_GRD_3X3

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FLIGHT_LINE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Flight line identifies where the aircraft/instrument has flown to acquire data.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: GROUP_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: ID that helps ASF group products

AdditionalAttributes.Name: OFF_NADIR_ANGLE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The angle the sensor points away from the satellite's nadir (off to the side). Larger angles correspond to imaging farther away from the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: MD5SUM
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Checksum

AdditionalAttributes.Name: GRANULE_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Identifies the type of data by combining platform, beam mode type, and coverage (frame/swath)

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASCENDING_DESCENDING
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes whether the satellite travel direction was ascending towards the north pole, or descending towards the south pole.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_SIZE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The number of SAR images over the same location in the entire ASF archive. Used for data that may be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: In most cases the same as beam mode. For Radarsat indicates both resolution and off-nadir pointing angle. Standard beam mode becomes ST1 though ST7 beammodetype, with ST7 pointing farthest from the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_BASELINE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The perpendicular distance between two satellites when they took the related two images. Useful for identifying image pairs to use for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_FRAME_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: ID of the center frame

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_ESA_FRAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The European Space Agency equivalent to the value in the FRAME_NUMBER field

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ACQUISITION_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Date the data was acquired by the satellite or aircraft + instrument.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: MISSION_NAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The sitenames where AIRSAR, AIMOSS, and UAVSAR acqusitions were taken.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the center of the scene or frame.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The general type of active sensor used. Values indicate image resolution: such as standard, fine, wide, scansar wide, SM (strip mode), EW (extra wide). Or indicate resolution + polarization: FBS (fine beam dual polarization), FBD (fine beam dual pol). Or atypically the type of product: TOPSAR (high resolution DEM), RPI (repeat pass interferometry), XTI (across track interferometry). Or resolution and product type IW (interferometric wide).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_DESC
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Text that describes the beam mode

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates the type of product, such as browse, metadata, L1, complex, amplitude, projected, terrain corrected.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DESCRIPTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes what the data was processed to. For example: low resolution terrain corrected ALOS data.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FRAME_NUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The designated frame or scene as defined by various space agencies (ESA, JAXA, CSA) each of which have their own scheme. The frame describes a box over the Earth at a fixed latitude. Combined with a path number (for longitude it identifies a specific piece of ground).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_LEVEL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates how much processing has been done to the data: L1, L1.0 unprocessed; L1.1 single look complex; L1, L1.5 amplitude image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The date the data was processed

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging began nearest the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: DOPPLER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The doppler centroid frequency - Useful for sar processing and interferometry. Related to the squint of the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE_DISPLAY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Label that will be displayed in ASF's Vertex interface

AdditionalAttributes.Name: POLARIZATION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Radar transmissions are polarized, with components normally termed vertical (V) and horizontal (H). Vertical means that the electric vector is in the plane of incidence; horizontal means the electric vector is perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: THUMBNAIL_URL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: URL that points to this granule's thumbnail image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASF_PLATFORM
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Internal ASF platform name

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: An ASF-assigned unique number used internally to unifiy SAR images over the same location. Used for data that might be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: LOOK_DIRECTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: SAR imagery is taken with the sensor pointing either left or right of the satellite. Most data is right-looking. A small amount of Radarsat is left-looking.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PATH_NUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The path describes a path the satellite will follow over the earth similar to longitude; each path has an assigned number. Combined with a frame number is identifies a specific piece of ground.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FARADAY_ROTATION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: An effect of the ionisphere that rotates polarizations from HH or VV or HV or VH. Significant for L or P band. Rotation over 5 degrees reduces usefulness for applications such as forest biomass. Effect is reduced at solar minimum.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BYTES
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Product size in bytes.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the center of the scene or frame.

ProcessingLevel.ProcessingLevelDescription: UAVSAR PolSAR Scene contains calibrated multi-looked cross products (3x3), floating point format, three files 8 bytes per pixel, three files 4 bytes per pixel, little endian.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BYTES
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Product size in bytes.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the center of the scene or frame.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FLIGHT_LINE

AdditionalAttributes.Name: GROUP_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: ID that helps ASF group products

AdditionalAttributes.Name: OFF_NADIR_ANGLE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The angle the sensor points away from the satellite's nadir (off to the side). Larger angles correspond to imaging farther away from the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: MD5SUM
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Checksum

AdditionalAttributes.Name: GRANULE_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Identifies the type of data by combining platform, beam mode type, and coverage (frame/swath)

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASCENDING_DESCENDING
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes whether the satellite travel direction was ascending towards the north pole, or descending towards the south pole.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_END_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_SIZE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The number of SAR images over the same location in the entire ASF archive. Used for data that may be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: In most cases the same as beam mode. For Radarsat indicates both resolution and off-nadir pointing angle. Standard beam mode becomes ST1 though ST7 beammodetype, with ST7 pointing farthest from the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_BASELINE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The perpendicular distance between two satellites when they took the related two images. Useful for identifying image pairs to use for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_FRAME_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: ID of the center frame

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_ESA_FRAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The European Space Agency equivalent to the value in the FRAME_NUMBER field

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ACQUISITION_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Date the data was acquired by the satellite or aircraft + instrument.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: MISSION_NAME
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The sitenames where AIRSAR, AIMOSS, and UAVSAR acqusitions were taken.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: CENTER_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the center of the scene or frame.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The general type of active sensor used. Values indicate image resolution: such as standard, fine, wide, scansar wide, SM (strip mode), EW (extra wide). Or indicate resolution + polarization: FBS (fine beam dual polarization), FBD (fine beam dual pol). Or atypically the type of product: TOPSAR (high resolution DEM), RPI (repeat pass interferometry), XTI (across track interferometry). Or resolution and product type IW (interferometric wide).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: BEAM_MODE_DESC
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Text that describes the beam mode

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates the type of product, such as browse, metadata, L1, complex, amplitude, projected, terrain corrected.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DESCRIPTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Describes what the data was processed to. For example: low resolution terrain corrected ALOS data.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FRAME_NUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The designated frame or scene as defined by various space agencies (ESA, JAXA, CSA) each of which have their own scheme. The frame describes a box over the Earth at a fixed latitude. Combined with a path number (for longitude it identifies a specific piece of ground).

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_LEVEL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Indicates how much processing has been done to the data: L1, L1.0 unprocessed; L1.1 single look complex; L1, L1.5 amplitude image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_DATE
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The date the data was processed

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging began nearest the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: DOPPLER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: The doppler centroid frequency - Useful for sar processing and interferometry. Related to the squint of the satellite.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LAT
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NEAR_END_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended nearest to the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper left corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSING_TYPE_DISPLAY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Label that will be displayed in ASF's Vertex interface

AdditionalAttributes.Name: POLARIZATION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Radar transmissions are polarized, with components normally termed vertical (V) and horizontal (H). Vertical means that the electric vector is in the plane of incidence; horizontal means the electric vector is perpendicular to the plane of incidence.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: FAR_START_LON
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Latitude of the granule where imaging began farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the lower right corner of a north-oriented image.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: THUMBNAIL_URL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: URL that points to this granule's thumbnail image

AdditionalAttributes.Name: ASF_PLATFORM
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Internal ASF platform name

AdditionalAttributes.Name: INSAR_STACK_ID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: An ASF-assigned unique number used internally to unifiy SAR images over the same location. Used for data that might be used for interferometry.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: LOOK_DIRECTION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: SAR imagery is taken with the sensor pointing either left or right of the satellite. Most data is right-looking. A small amount of Radarsat is left-looking.

AdditionalAttributes.Description: The path describes a path the satellite will follow over the earth similar to longitude; each path has an assigned number. Combined with a frame number is identifies a specific piece of ground.

AdditionalAttributes.Description: An effect of the ionisphere that rotates polarizations from HH or VV or HV or VH. Significant for L or P band. Rotation over 5 degrees reduces usefulness for applications such as forest biomass. Effect is reduced at solar minimum.

AdditionalAttributes.Description: Longitude of the granule where imaging ended farthest from the satellite. For an ascending satellite, it locates the upper right corner of a north-oriented image.
